snippet: The first woman to lead the Army’s drill sergeant school is being reinstated after she was suspended in November for reasons the Army has never explained, her lawyer and the Army said.
abstract: Command Sgt Maj Teresa King is being reinstated as commandant of Army's drill sergeant school at Fort Jackson, SC, after she was suspended for reasons the Army has never explained; King filed a military legal complaint alleging that her suspension was the result of racism and sexism.
lead_paragraph: The first woman to lead the Army’s drill sergeant school is being reinstated after she was suspended in November for reasons the Army has never explained, her lawyer and the Army said.

headline.main: South Carolina: Reinstatement at Drill Sergeant School
headline.print_headline: South Carolina: Reinstatement at Drill Sergeant School
